doc.after: The RÃ­o de la Plata was first explored by the Portuguese in 1512-1513.[8][9] The Spanish first explored it in 1516, when the navigator Juan DÃ­az de SolÃ­s traversed it during his search for a passage between the Atlantic and the Pacific Oceans, naming it the Mar Dulce, or fresh water sea.[3] The Portuguese navigator Ferdinand Magellan briefly explored the estuary in 1520 before his expedition continued its circumnavigation,[3] and in 1521 CristÃ³vÃ£o Jacques also explored the Plate River estuary and ascended for the first time the Parana River, entering it for about 23 leagues (around 140Â km), to near the present city of Rosario.[10]
